entry.title: Homemade Salted Caramel
entry.summary: From Sallys Baking Addiction. Heat sugar in saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly with silicone spatula. Sugar will clump…
entry.content:
From Sallys Baking Addiction.

Amount Ingredients
1 c granulated sugar
6 tbs salted butter
1/2 c heavy cream
1 tsp salt

 Heat sugar in saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly with silicone spatula. Sugar will clump and slowly melt into a thick, amber colored liquid as you stir. Move heat down as necessary to avoid burning caramelized sugar.

Once completely melted, lower heat (maybe even remove from heat temporarily), add butter in stages. Careful, as caramel will bubble and splatter. Stir in butter until completely melted (around 2 minutes) being very careful not to burn it.

Slowly drizzle in heavy cream while stirring, allow to boil for 1 minute (will rise in pan as boils, so ensure have extra space in pan).

Officially remove from heat and stir in salt. Allow to slightly cool (thicken) before using.

Can reheat in microwave or stove to get smoother consistency for pouring, if necessary.

entry.title: Homemade Pie Crust
entry.summary: Makes a 'classic double pie-crust' (the top and bottom). Mix of King Arthur Classic Double Pie Crust and Sally's…
entry.content:
Makes a 'classic double pie-crust' (the top and bottom). Mix of King Arthur Classic Double Pie Crust and Sally's Baking Addiction Homemade Buttery Flaky Pie Crust.

Amount Ingredient
2 1/2 c All-purpose flour
2 sticks unsalted butter (cold) (no shortening recipe)
1 1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup very cold water

 Mix flour and salt in stand mixer (speed 2). Add in butter in ~1tbs sections at a time. Then add in water, a little bit at a time (stop when dough begins to form large clumps). Stop when still have small pea-sized chunks of butter visble in dough, but mostly a cohesive unit.

Move dough to floured work surface. Should come together easily and not feel overly sticky. Form into quick ball, split in half with knife/slicer. Roll out bottom with rolling pin, place in pie mold, move to fridge. Roll out top pieces, cut into slices, place on cookie sheet, move to fridge. Let sit in fridge for ~2 hours.

entry.title: Lemon Sugar Snap Peas
entry.summary: Heat 1 tbs olive oil in skillet. Add snap peas, toss to coat. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
entry.content:
Heat 1 tbs olive oil in skillet. Add snap peas, toss to coat. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.

Add zest from one lemon, dash of salt, pepper (thyme, if desired). Cook for additional 3-5 minutes (until snap peas begin to puff up and are crisp, yet tender). Key is to have them puff up, though taste fine if not all are puffy.

entry.title: Lemon Salmon
entry.summary: Heat olive oil (1tbs) in skillet. Add salmon (2 -4 fillets), season with salt and pepper. Cook each side…
entry.content:
Heat olive oil (1tbs) in skillet. Add salmon (2 -4 fillets), season with salt and pepper. Cook each side until deeply golden brown (about 6 min. each). MUST cook scale side and reverse (cannot cook sides or will fall apart). Move to plate when finished.

Reduce heat, add 1tbs butter, 2 cloves garlic, juice of one lemon + zest. Cook for 2 minutes.

Add thinly sliced second lemon to skillet, season with more salt and pepper. Simmer on low until reduced (3-5 minutes).

Return salmon to skillet (with sauce ingredients) and simmer until salmon is cooked through (3-4 minutes). Add 2 tbs butter (additional) to create creamy sauce (at end?).

entry.title: Chuy's Jalapeno Ranch
entry.summary: An approximation hoping to match the taste, without the morbidity-inducing ingredients. Mix for 30 seconds in food processor to…
entry.content:
An approximation hoping to match the taste, without the morbidity-inducing ingredients.

Amount Ingredient
3 tbs Ranch mix
1 big spoon (tbs?) Mayonnaise
2 cups (16 oz) sour cream
4 tbs (or a bunch of) cilantro
1/2 jalapeno
2 tsp (or 1/2 lime?) lime juice
1 tsp salt (might be overkill with ranch mix)
1 tsp garlic powder (also likely in ranch mix)

 Mix for 30 seconds in food processor to chop cilantro and jalapeno, mix ingredients.

Comes out too green and flavorful. Chuy's has more creaminess to it. Some recipes add much more mayonnaise and buttermilk, perhaps to achieve this. We tried to compensate with a pinch of milk, which came close but was not perfect.

entry.title: Dutch Oven Sweet Chicken Curry
entry.summary: Some sort of sweet curry with traditional indian ingredients (though recipe is made up by me!).AmountIngredient1 tbsgaram masala1 tspcumin1/2…
entry.content:
Some sort of sweet curry with traditional indian ingredients (though recipe is made up by me!).

Amount Ingredient
1 tbs garam masala
1 tsp cumin
1/2 tsp turmeric
1/4 tsp chili powder
1/2 tsp amchur
dash (or more of a douse?) indian brown sugar
1 or 2 chicken breasts
dash sunflower oil
fair amount coconut milk
  •  brown chicken in oil, then remove chicken to side.
  • cook ghee, onion in remaining oil for a few minutes ~3 or 4
  • add spices, garlic, ginger, and cook some more ~2 minutes
  • add coconut milk (fair amount), then the chicken back in. Boil, then simmer for 25 minutes.

entry.title: Dutch Oven Rotisserie Chicken
entry.summary: A fall-off-the-bone delicious rotisserie chicken made with relatively little effort.Add olive oil to bottom of dutch oven (less than…
entry.content:
A fall-off-the-bone delicious rotisserie chicken made with relatively little effort.

  • Add olive oil to bottom of dutch oven (less than full coating of bottom).
  • Rinse chicken, remove pieces from cavity, pat dry with paper towel.
  • Chop carrots (~4), onion (1/2).
  • Place chicken in dutch oven breast side down. Sprinkle heavily with Old Bay. Flip chicken breast side up, sprinkle again heavily with Old Bay.
  • Add carrots and onion to sides and inside chicken.
  • Add three to four slices of butter on top of/around chicken.
  • Cook at 375 for just under an hour and a half. Then take off lid and cook for another 5-10 minutes to brown the outside of the chicken.
  • Remove from heat and let rest for at least 10 minutes before cutting (to preserve the juices and prevent meat from drying out).
  • Shred the chicken and save the broth for chicken soup later! (Will need to add water to broth).

entry.title: Carnitas - Dutch Oven
entry.summary: remove orange halves, onion, and bay leavessimmer to reduce (stirring frequently) until thick and syrupy (around 1 cup liquid)…
entry.content:
• remove orange halves, onion, and bay leaves
  • simmer to reduce (stirring frequently) until thick and syrupy (around 1 cup liquid) - (8-12 minutes)
  • pull apart meat with forks, season with salt and pepper
  • spread just meat across top of broiler pan, drizzle with remaining syrup
    • broil until meat browned and crispy (only one or two minutes)
    • flip/stir meat, go for another minute or so (can hear sizzle)

entry.title: Lemon Chicken (Quick Chicken Piccata)
entry.summary: From the cover of a keto magazine Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper (brine). Use 1 tbs of the…
entry.content:
From the cover of a keto magazine

Amount Ingredient
1 - 1 1/2 lbs chicken
3 tbs oil
~ 3/4 cup+ wine (moscato)
~ 4 green onions
2 cloves garlic
1 tsp thyme
1 1/2 tbs butter
as desired lemon juice
1/2 tsp  salt
1/2 tsp pepper

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper (brine).

Use 1 tbs of the oil to cook chicken for five minutes in flat pan. 

Turn chicken over, add the wine, onions, garlic, and thyme to pan; cook 2 minutes.

Add remaining 2 tbs oil, bring to a boil.

Reduce heat to medium, cook 8 minutes.

Remove pan from heat. Stir in lemon juice and butter. Sprinkle with thyme leaves and place onto a bed of spinach (if desired).

entry.title: Turkey Chili
entry.summary: Instant pot altered Panera chili recipe Saute onions and olive oil for ~3 minutes. Add turkey and spices, brown…
entry.content:
Instant pot altered Panera chili recipe

Amount Ingredient
2 tbs olive oil
some onion
1 tsp salt
lots Rudy's Turkey Rub
1 tsp green chili powder
1 can kidney beans
1 can garbanzo beans
1 can whole kernel corn
1 can tomatos diced
1 can  tomato sauce
10 baby carrots

 Saute onions and olive oil for ~3 minutes. Add turkey and spices, brown the turkey.

Add remaining ingredients and cook on high pressure for 12 mintues.
